intro: Sida betonicifolia, commonly known as the "Mexican mallow," is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its woolly, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida betonicifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
